channel.title: Comments on: Need help with your Domino development?

item.title: By: Miguel Calvo
item.dc:creator: Miguel Calvo
item.description: <p>Matt,<br /> I've been a contractor in Spain for 3 years and things don't work exactly the same here. I work mainly for consulting companies because the final customer, never ever uses contractors directly. So there's a tiny market for contractors in Spain, quite different from English one.<br /> On the other hand, dealing with final customers lets you detect necesities and projects that could improve substantially their bussiness processes. That fits more with a consulting role than with a developing one.<br /> Becoming a consultant means you are a company now. Congratulations for your decission and good luck. You've got enough experience and good Lotus software produtcs to be succesful. Being brave is the best way to go ahead ! <img alt="Emoticon" src="<a rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GJG/$File/cheesy.gif"</a> /> <br /><br /> Miguel Calvo<br /></p>
item.content:encoded:
Matt,
I’ve been a contractor in Spain for 3 years and things don’t work exactly the same here. I work mainly for consulting companies because the final customer, never ever uses contractors directly. So there’s a tiny market for contractors in Spain, quite different from English one.
On the other hand, dealing with final customers lets you detect necesities and projects that could improve substantially their bussiness processes. That fits more with a consulting role than with a developing one.
Becoming a consultant means you are a company now. Congratulations for your decission and good luck. You’ve got enough experience and good Lotus software produtcs to be succesful. Being brave is the best way to go ahead ! http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GJG/$File/cheesy.gif“ />

Miguel Calvo
